isis.stitle: INTERNATIONAL 4X2 AND 6X4 SPRING SUSPENSION WITH TORQUE RODS - RETIGHTENING U-BOLT NUTS

svcproc.title: RETIGHTENING U-BOLT NUTS
svcproc.para: U-bolt nuts must be retightened at the intervals listed below. This applies to both new vehicles and to vehicles on which spring service has been performed.

step1.para: The U-boIt nuts must be retightened after the vehicle has operated under load for 1,000 miles (1600 kilometers) or six months, whichever occurs first.
Thereafter, the spring U-bolt nuts should be retightened every 100,000 miles (160,900 kilometers).

note.para: When checking U-bolts to determine if looseness has occurred, rusty joints must be disassembled, cleaned and lubricated to assure a like-new condition prior to tightening to specifications.
